name: Prod_Phishing_Investigation
creator: 4ef699ee-76df-410b-8a5d-67d28937cbfe
description:
Playbook used to enrich emails pulled in via a connector to the suspicious email triage mailbox.

It works with two main reporting mechanisms (MS Report Phishing add-in and Proofpoint's PhishAlarm Analyzer). Entities are submitted for enhancement to VirusTotal, VMRay, Anomali

steps.name: Siemplify_Close Case
steps.description: Closes the case the current alert has been grouped to

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Reason":"NotMalicious","Root Cause":"Genuine","Comment":"Email has been found to be genuine."}

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: Does the SOC want to respond to someone who reported a sender on the list of safe senders with the template or a manual response?

parameters.name: Answers
parameters.value: {"1":"Yes","2":"No - Manual response will be sent instead"}

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: Respond back to reporter of safe sender with "Genuine Email" template?

steps.name: Exchange_Send Mail HTML
steps.description: Send spam email template response to all submitters.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value:
{"Subject":"[Get_Context_Value_Email_Subject.ScriptResult] Suspicious Email Reported","Send to":"Suspicious Email Triage Response","CC":"","BCC":"[Get_Case_Data_Spam.JsonResult| \"insights\" | filter(\"title\", \"=\", \"Suspicious Email Reported\") | \"content\"]","Attachments Paths":"[Save_B64_To_File_Backup_Spam.JsonResult| \"files\" | filter(\"extension\", \"=\", \".eml\") | \"file_path\"]","Mail content":"{\"Content\":\"
\\n\\n\\n\",\"ContentTemplateName\":\"\",\"HtmlTemplateName\":\"Marketing Email\"}"}

steps.name: Prod_Analyze_Headers
steps.description: This block accepts email headers and performs various risk checks to create an aggregate risk score for a suspicious email.

steps.name: Siemplify_Add General Insight
steps.description: Add links to processes in Confluence on responsive actions and how to perform them. This will appear in the case wall as an insight.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Title":"Incident Handling Links","Message":"Block URL - EP_00005: https://confluence.admiral.uk:8443/display/SK/EP_00005+- +Blocking+outbound+traffic+on+the+UPE+Proxy+Server Block Inboud Sender - EP_00006: https://confluence.admiral.uk:8443/display/SK/EP_00006+- +Symantec+Email+Security.Cloud+-Block+Inbound+Sender Delete Email from Mailbox - EP_00029: https://confluence.admiral.uk:8443/display/SK/EP_00029+- +Delete+emails+from+mailboxes? src=contextnavpagetreemode Symantec Management Centre - Block URL/domains https://pr-swmc-002.admiral.uk:8082/login.jsp Message Labs - Block Email Addresses https://clients.messagelabs.com/Configuration/Email-Security/Anti-Spam/AntiSpam.aspx ","Triggered By":"Incident Handling Links"}

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: This step conditions the progress of the playbook according to a question the analyst has to answer manually, would be used most for questions which can't be answered automatically

parameters.name: Answers
parameters.value: {"1":"Yes?","2":"No - Manual response will be sent instead"}

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: Do you want to send spearphishing template email as a response to the submitter(s)?

steps.name: Siemplify_Case Tag
steps.description: Add given tag to the case the current alert is grouped to

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: This condition determines the progress of the playbook. Conditions are built based on cases data (cases, alerts, vents, entities and environment properties) as-well as data that comes back from previous playbook steps.

steps.name: FileUtilities_Save Base64 to File
steps.description: The action saves a base64 string to a file.  It supports comma separated lists for Filename and Base64 Input.  The optional File Extension parameter is used to add an extension to the output filename.

steps.name: Entity Selection
steps.description: Creates an entity group that consists of the sender of the suspicios email to allow for it to be used in the "Search similar cases"

steps.name: Tools_Buffer
steps.description: The action receives a json string and returns it as a json result that can be processed by other actions in Chronicle SOAR natively

steps.name: Siemplify_Case Tag
steps.description: Add given tag to the case the current alert is grouped to

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: Check whether the sender is on a whitelist and whether the email is internal.

steps.name: GoogleChronicle_Execute UDM Query
steps.description: Return all emails that have the same email subject as the subject in the suspicious email

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Query":"metadata.event_type=\"EMAIL_TRANSACTION\" AND  network.email.subject=\"[Get_Context_Value_Email_Subject.ScriptResult]\" ","Time Frame":"Last Month","Start Time":"","End Time":"","Max Results To Return":"200"}

steps.name: Siemplify_Assign Case
steps.description: Assigned to SOC Triage Analyst.

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: This condition determines the progress of the playbook. Conditions are built based on cases data (cases, alerts, vents, entities and environment properties) as-well as data that comes back from previous playbook steps.

steps.name: Siemplify_Close Case
steps.description: Closes the case the current alert has been grouped to

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Reason":"NotMalicious","Root Cause":"Spam","Comment":"Email has been found to be spam/marketing."}

steps.name: FileUtilities_Save Base64 to File
steps.description: The action saves a base64 string to a file.  It supports comma separated lists for Filename and Base64 Input.  The optional File Extension parameter is used to add an extension to the output filename.

steps.name: Siemplify_Case Tag
steps.description: Add tag that is an approved internal sender

steps.instanceName: Check if email has been reported before
steps.name: Condition
steps.description: Submissions of the same email within a certain timeframe will all get combined into one case as separate alerts on the basis of a common email subject (as long as a case remains open). We only want the full playbook to run on the first reported email since the assessment will be the same for all submissions of the same email.

steps.name: EmailUtilities_Parse Case Wall Email - Symantec
steps.description: This action will parse an EML or MSG file that has been attached to the case wall and extract entities. Excludes image files from being parsed out as entities.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Create Entities":true,"Exclude Entities Regex":"(?:\\.JPG)|(?:\\.GIF)|(?:\\.jpg)|(?:\\.gif)|(?:\\.jpeg)|(?:\\.css)|(?:\\.PNG)|(?:\\.png)","Original EML Only":true,"Create Observed Entities":"All","Save Attachments to Case Wall":true,"Fang Entities":true,"Custom Entity Regexes":"{ }"}

steps.name: HatchingTriage_Get Screenshot
steps.description: Use scan IDs from Hatching triage to return task results (including screenshot url, report url from urlscan.io)

steps.name: Tools_Change Case Name
steps.description: Change the case name to be of the email subject only - the goal is that Phish Alarm and MS phishing submissions are combined into the same case where the same email is reported.

steps.name: Tools_Set Context Value
steps.description: The action sets a key and value in a specific context (alert or case)

steps.name: Entity Selection
steps.description:
Creates a group of entities that can be used as an input to various url enrichment actions - filters out urls that are well known and for which enrichment would bring no value and consume resources and API calls.

This action is the first stage.

steps.name: Siemplify_Case Tag
steps.description: Add tag to show that the email was reported using MS addin

steps.name: Exchange_Send Mail HTML
steps.description: Send generic phishing email template response to all submitters.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value:
{"Subject":"[Get_Context_Value_Email_Subject.ScriptResult] Suspicious Email Reported","Send to":"Suspicious Email Triage Response","CC":"","BCC":"[Get_Case_Data_Generic_Phishing.JsonResult| \"insights\" | filter(\"title\", \"=\", \"Suspicious Email Reported\") | \"content\"]","Attachments Paths":"","Mail content":"{\"Content\":\"
\\n\\n\\n\",\"ContentTemplateName\":\"\",\"HtmlTemplateName\":\"Generic Phishing\"}"}

steps.name: Tools_Set Context Value
steps.description: The action sets a key and value in a specific context (alert or case)

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: This step conditions the progress of the playbook according to a question the analyst has to answer manually, would be used most for questions which can't be answered automatically

parameters.name: Answers
parameters.value: {"1":"Yes?","2":"No - Manual response will be sent instead"}

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: Do you want to send the malicious email template response to the reporters?

steps.name: Siemplify_Close Case
steps.description: Malicious URL has been identified

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Reason":"Malicious","Root Cause":"Malicious URL","Comment":"Malicious URL has been flagged in a phishing email"}

steps.name: Tools_Get Case Data
steps.description: This action will get all the data from a case and return a JSON result.  The result includes comments, entity information, insights, playbooks that ran, alert information and events.

steps.name: Siemplify_Close Case
steps.description: Malicious attachment has been identified

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Reason":"Malicious","Root Cause":"Malicious Attachment","Comment":"Malicious attachment has been flagged in a phishing email"}

steps.name: Enrichment_Enrich Entity With Field
steps.description: This enrichment adds a field that will allow for URL_Filter to be passed into a second filter stage.

steps.name: Functions_String Functions
steps.description: This action will split the sanitized html body by using end email headers as the separator and returning the split string as an array.

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: Check on whether an email is an item was sent to VMRay from the mailbox manually from the suspicious email mailbox or someone sent an automated reply back.

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: This checks if the exclude entities parameter breaks the parsing email action and proceeds accordingly.

steps.name: Siemplify_Add General Insight
steps.description: Add a general insight saying approved entity has been found.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Title":"Approved Entity Found","Message":"This email has either an approved header or sender","Triggered By":""}

steps.name: Siemplify_Close Case
steps.description: Closes the case the current alert has been grouped to

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Reason":"Malicious","Root Cause":"Generic Phishing","Comment":"Email has been found to be a generic phishing email."}

steps.name: Tools_Get Case Data
steps.description: This action will get all the data from a case and return a JSON result.  The result includes comments, entity information, insights, playbooks that ran, alert information and events.

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: Analyst completes assessment of submitted email

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: What type of email is this?

steps.name: Lists_Is String In Custom List
steps.description: Checks if the from email is on the phishing_external_approved_headers custom list.

steps.name: Exchange_Send Mail HTML
steps.description: Send email telling submitter to use one of the two authorised methods.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value:
{"Subject":"Phishing Report","Send to":"[Email_Parsing_Output.JsonResult| \"parsed_emails.result.header.from\"]","CC":"","BCC":"","Attachments Paths":"[Save_Base64_to _Local_File.JsonResult| \"files\" | filter(\"extension\", \"=\", \".eml\") | \"file_path\"]","Mail content":"{\"Content\":\"
\",\"ContentTemplateName\":\"\",\"HtmlTemplateName\":\"Incorrect Phishing Report\"}"}

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: This step conditions the progress of the playbook according to a question the analyst has to answer manually, would be used most for questions which can't be answered automatically

steps.name: Tools_Set Context Value
steps.description: Extract email headers from a Phish Alarm reported email and save as a specific global variable that can be used in the playbook view.

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: There is a possibility where the first person to report an email does so incorrectly and that this email becomes grouped together with other submissions that were reported correctly - this then leaves none of the emails analysed by the rest of the playbook.

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: Do you want to have the rest of the playbook run even if this is a duplicate email (E.g. this is a duplicate email to an email reported in an incorrect manner)? Please keep in mind running playbooks unnecessarily will waste API quotas and could impact Chronicle SOAR's performance. Please check that the email you're selecting for further processing was reported correctly using one of the supported reporting mechanisms.

steps.name: GoogleChronicle_Execute UDM Query
steps.description: Return all emails to the submitter of the suspicious email

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Query":"metadata.event_type=\"EMAIL_TRANSACTION\" AND email = /.*[Get_Context_Value_Email_To.ScriptResult].*/ nocase AND network.direction=\"INBOUND\"","Time Frame":"Last Month","Start Time":"","End Time":"","Max Results To Return":"50"}

steps.name: FileUtilities_Get Attachment
steps.description: The actions gets an attachment from the case wall (the result is presented as a Base64). This is the first step to be able to submit the files for analysis to VMRay.

steps.name: Siemplify_Change Priority
steps.description: 3 or 4 suspicious entities - assign high case priority

steps.name: HatchingTriage_Analyse URL
steps.description: Submit URL to Hatching Triage so that analysis can start and the urls can be submitted to URLScan.io private scans. This will return scan IDs that can be used in future steps. Following steps happen at the end of the playbook to give time for the analysis to proceed.

steps.name: MDTI-Test_Enrich Entity
steps.description:
Enriches IPs or hostnames using Microsoft's Defender TI data.

https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-defender-threat/what-s-new-apis-in-microsoft-graph/ba-p/3780350
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/security-api-overview?view=graph-rest-beta#alerts-and-incidents-preview

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Create MDTI Insight":true,"Only suspicious entity insight":true,"Reputation Threshold":"suspicious"}

steps.name: Prod_VirusTotal_Enrichment
steps.description: This block accepts an alert as input and enhances IPs, domains and hashes with TI where available. No entity enhancement is created if none is available in VT.

steps.name: MultiChoiceQuestion
steps.description: This step conditions the progress of the playbook according to a question the analyst has to answer manually, would be used most for questions which can't be answered automatically

parameters.name: Question
parameters.value: Is this a malicious URL or attachment?

steps.name: Enrichment_Enrich Entity With Field
steps.description: This enrichment adds a field that will allow for URL_Filter to be passed into a second filter stage.

steps.name: Siemplify_Case Tag
steps.description: Tag the alert as incorrectly submitted (e.g. manually forwarded, manually added as an attachment and then sent). This branch also acts as a catch all branch for auto replies, manual replies back to submission verdicts and any other edge cases.

steps.name: Tools_Find First Alert
steps.description: This action checks if the alert is an email that has been reported for the first time. Uniqueness within a case of the suspicious email connector is done on an email subject basis.

steps.name: Tools_Set Context Value
steps.description: Extract email headers from a MS reported email and save as a specific global variable that can be used in the playbook view.

steps.name: Siemplify_Add General Insight
steps.description: Adds a general entity insight to the case wall that this alert has been caused to a duplicate submission of a suspicious email (regardless of the fact that all submissions are important and welcome).

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Title":"Duplicate Email","Message":"This alert is grouped to the case as a duplicate email. This means more than one person reported this email. ","Triggered By":""}

steps.name: Exchange_Send Mail HTML
steps.description: Send spearphishing email template response to all submitters.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value:
{"Subject":"[Get_Context_Value_Email_Subject.ScriptResult] Suspicious Email Reported","Send to":"Suspicious Email Triage Response","CC":"","BCC":"[Get_Case_Data_Spearphishing.JsonResult| \"insights\" | filter(\"title\", \"=\", \"Suspicious Email Reported\") | \"content\"]","Attachments Paths":"","Mail content":"{\"Content\":\"

steps.name: Entity Selection
steps.description: Creates a group of entities that can be used as an input to various url enrichment actions - filters out urls that are well known and for which enrichment would bring no value and consume resources and API calls.

steps.name: Prod_Domain_Investigation
steps.description: Enriches URLs, Emails, Domains, and IP addresses with WHOIS information.  Will create domain entities and link to URLs and Emails.  Will set any domain that is less than 180 days old as suspicious.  Checks to see if domains are look a like domains.

steps.name: Tools_Get Case Data
steps.description: This action will get all the data from a case and return a JSON result.  The result includes comments, entity information, insights, playbooks that ran, alert information and events.

steps.name: Condition
steps.description: Checks if the submitted email is an internal email by checking if it has the external tag in the email subject.

steps.name: EmailUtilities_Parse Case Wall Email - Symantec
steps.description: This action will parse an EML or MSG file that has been attached to the case wall and extract entities. Excludes image files from being parsed out as entities. This does not exclude any images from being parsed out and is used as a backstop if the base parse case wall action fails.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Create Entities":true,"Exclude Entities Regex":"","Original EML Only":true,"Create Observed Entities":"All","Save Attachments to Case Wall":true,"Fang Entities":false,"Custom Entity Regexes":"{ }"}

steps.name: AnomaliThreatStream_Enrich Entities
steps.description: Retrieve information about IPs, URLs, hashes or User entities with Email regexes from Siemplify ThreatFuse. If multiple records are found for the same entity, action will enrich using the latest record. Entity insights will only be created if the entities were found to be suspicious by Anomali.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Severity Threshold":"Medium","Confidence Threshold":"50","Ignore False Positive Status":false,"Add Threat Type To Case":false,"Create Insight":true,"Only Suspicious Entity Insight":true}

steps.name: Functions_SanitizeHTML
steps.description: Given a fragment of HTML, SantizeHTML will parse it according to the HTML5 parsing algorithm and sanitize any disallowed tags or attributes. This algorithm also takes care of things like unclosed and (some) misnested tags.

parameters.name: ScriptParametersEntityFields
parameters.value: {"Tags":"a,abbr,acronym,b,blockquote,code,em,i,li,ol,strong,ul,table,tr,td,th,h1,h2,h3,body,tbody,thead,div,footer,head,header,html,img,option,p,section,span,strong,svg,br,h4","Attributes":"src,width,style,role,cellspacing,cellpadding,class","Styles":"color,background-color,width,font-family,font-weight,text-align,padding,border-color,border-style,border-width,align-items,height,text-align, text-decoration, bgcolor","Allow All Attributes":false,"Input HTML":"[Email_Parsing_Output.JsonResult| \"parsed_emails.attached_emails.body\" | filter(\"content_type\", \"=\", \"text/html\") | \"content\"]"}
